title: Lesson 1
paragraph: This lesson introduces common everyday action verbs. Practicing these will help you describe daily activities, decisions, and simple interactions with ease.

words.meaning: to agree to receive or take something offered
to successfully reach a goal through effort

words.example: I advised her to check the facts first.

words.meaning: to have the same opinion or accept a proposal
words.example: They agreed on the meeting time.

words.meaning: to permit someone to do something

words.example: The company announced a new product.

words.meaning: to become visible or to seem a certain way
words.japaneseMeaning: 現れる／〜のように見える
words.example: He appeared tired after the trip.

words.meaning: to put to practical use or to request something formally
to give reasons for or against something; to disagree
words.example: They argued about the best route.

words.meaning: to keep away from someone or something
to take and use something belonging to someone with intention to return
